body:
So, I wanted to know if this is punishable. As in punishable I mean a kick, maybe even a temp-ban (although I don't think it's possible)

Is saying things like "Omg, sky is in hub 1, go out there before he goes punishable? Because your spreading lies and it is sort of advertising and your trying to make players leave forcefully. Is it /report able?

 Thanks
body_tagged:

title: Is this punishable in anyway?

replies.body:
This is very well considered "scamming" by lying to players.
So yes, this may be punishable.
replies.body_tagged:
This is very well considered "scamming" by lying to players.
So yes, this may be punishable.

replies.body: Yes! It definitely is. Its known as Scamming :D
replies.body_tagged: Yes! It definitely is. Its known as Scamming :D

replies.body: Misleading (or Scamming) others is against the rules and depending on the situation can lead to the offender being kicked or banned.
replies.body_tagged: Misleading (or Scamming) others is against the rules and depending on the situation can lead to the offender being kicked or banned.

replies.body: Ok thanks! Also, is it better to take a screenshot of when they are scamming because once they join (if they do eventually join) they won't do it again? Or is /report fine?
replies.body_tagged: Ok thanks! Also, is it better to take a screenshot of when they are scamming because once they join (if they do eventually join) they won't do it again? Or is /report fine?

replies.body: Yeah this the same as someone spams "Press alt F4 for free diamonds!!!!"
replies.body_tagged: Yeah this the same as someone spams "Press alt F4 for free diamonds!!!!"

replies.body:
Always take screenshots.
You will definately have proof that way.

But if they're persistant, you can /report.
